titlestmt.titleproper:
Susie Enos,
Papago Stories narrated by Jose Ventura 1968 Mss.497.P21

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T18:10-0400

did.unittitle: Papago Stories narrated by Jose Ventura
did.abstract:
Susie Enos was a native speaker of Tohono O'Odham and an early writer of her language. She contributed to the construction of a Papago dictionary in 1983.
The text collected by Susie Enos from a consultant, Jose Ventura, "Ho'ok Oks" (Witch, Green Hawk, Eagle) includes indications of the syntactic function elements in the sentences and other grammatical notes, with a separate, line-by-line English translation.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Susie Enos was a native speaker of Tohono O'Odham and an early writer of her language. She contributed to the construction of a Papago dictionary in 1983.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The text collected by Susie Enos from a consultant, Jose Ventura, "Ho'ok Oks" (Witch, Green Hawk, Eagle) includes indications of the syntactic function elements in the sentences and other grammatical notes, with a separate, line-by-line English translation.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Cite as: Susie Enos, Papago Stories narrated by Jose Ventura, American Philosophical Society.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: The Enos-Ventura text is also referenced in the online Daythal Kendall Guide to Native Collections at the American Philosophical Society (number 4625).
